channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: トゥルース・ソーシャルの親会社であるトランプ・メディア・アンド・テクノロジー・グループの第1四半期の売上高は771万ドル、純損失は3億2,760万ドル、営業損失は1,210万ドル（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Truth Social's parent company, the Trump Media and Technology Group, reports $771K in Q1 revenue, a net loss of $327.6M, and an operating loss of $12.1M  —  Trump Media and Technology Group, the company affiliated with former U.S. president Donald Trump that operates Truth Social …

item.title: ペンギン・ランダムハウス社は、アルフレッド・A・ノップフ社のレーガン・アーサー氏とパンテオン社およびショッケン社のリサ・ルーカス氏を解任した。
item.description:
New York Times:
In a significant shake-up, Penguin Random House dismisses Alfred A. Knopf publisher Reagan Arthur and Pantheon and Schocken publisher Lisa Lucas  —  The departures of Reagan Arthur, of Alfred A. Knopf, and Lisa Lucas, of Pantheon and Schocken, in a restructuring came as a surprise to many in the company.

item.title: 研究によれば、AIに関するメディアの報道は業界関係者が主導する傾向があり、技術の可能性に関する彼らの主張を額面通りに受け取ることが多い（Prof. Rasmus Kleis Nielsen/Reuters ...）
item.description:
Prof. Rasmus Kleis Nielsen / Reuters Institute:
Studies suggests that media coverage of AI tends to be led by industry sources and often takes their claims about the tech's potential at face value  —  “Research suggests that reporting tends to be led by industry sources, and often take claims at face value,” our Director Rasmus Nielsen writes

item.title: NYTニュースルームの "監察官 "シャーロット・ベーレンドのプロフィール。
item.description:
Charlotte Klein / Vanity Fair:
A profile of Charlotte Behrendt, the “inspector general” of NYT's newsroom whose “prosecutorial” style in probing internal matters has rankled some journalists  —  Charlotte Behrendt's “prosecutorial” style in probing internal Times matters has rankled some journalists …

item.title: ソーシャルメディアの習慣の変化に適応しようとするスナップが、広告事業を見直した後、AIとARに積極的に投資する方向にシフトしている様子（Alex Barinka/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Alex Barinka / Bloomberg:
A look at Snap's shift towards investing aggressively in AI and AR after revamping its ad business, as it tries to adapt to changing social media habits  —  - Messaging app turns attention to improved, personalized tools  — Company seeks to adapt to changing social media habits

item.title: GBニュース、公平性規則違反で制裁を受ける可能性（Ofcom）
item.description:
Ofcom:
GB News could face sanction after breaking due impartiality rules  —  An Ofcom investigation today concluded that People's Forum: The Prime Minister (PDF, 612.8 KB) on GB News broke broadcasting due impartiality rules.  Given this represents a serious and repeated breach of these rules …

item.title: オジーの創業者カルロス・ワトソンの裁判が今日、陪審員選考で始まった。ワトソンはオジーの資金を集めるために投資家を欺こうとした罪に問われている（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
The trial of Ozy founder Carlos Watson began today with jury selection; Watson is charged with trying to defraud investors to raise money for Ozy  —  Mr. Watson's lawyer has argued that many other media leaders lured investors with “puffing and bluffing,” and that Mr. Watson is being singled out because he is Black.

item.title: 英国高等法院、ジュリアン・アサンジ氏の米国への身柄引き渡しを不服とする上訴を認める判決を下す。
item.description:
Sky News:
UK High Court rules that Julian Assange can appeal against his extradition to the US because judges deemed US assurances insufficient  —  The US authorities want to put Julian Assange on trial over 18 charges, nearly all under the Espionage Act, with Monday's decision marking the latest chapter …

item.title: 英Ofcomは、GB Newsが公平性規則に「重大かつ繰り返し」違反しているとして法的制裁を検討しており、60日以内の決定を目指している（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
UK's Ofcom is considering a statutory sanction against GB News for “serious and repeated” breaches of impartiality rules and aims for a decision within 60 days  —  Broadcast regulator Ofcom has said it is considering a statutory sanction against GB News for “serious and repeated” breaches of due impartiality rules.

item.title: NFLは、ネットフリックスから1試合あたり7500万ドルを得ており、アマゾン、ユーチューブ、ディズニー、コムキャスト、フォックス、パラマウントで試合を放映している（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
The NFL knows it provides must-see TV, earning $75M/game from Netflix and showing games across Amazon, YouTube, Disney, Comcast, Fox, and Paramount  —  The two leading suitors for Paramount Global are both offering flawed deals.  What will the media mogul decide?

item.title: 多くのメディアがApple News+への依存度を高めており、Daily Beastは2024年に$3M-$4Mの収益を上げるとし、Timeは年間7桁の収益を上げるとしている（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Many outlets have increased reliance on Apple News+; The Daily Beast is set to make $3M-$4M from it in 2024, and Time says it delivers a 7-figure annual revenue  —  The Scoop  —  Like many digital publishers, The Daily Beast was struggling at the end of 2023.

item.title: アナリストによれば、NeflixのNFLとの契約は、従来のライブスポーツ投資を避けてきた同社の「自然な進化」であり、広告ビジネスを後押しするものだという（Alexandra Canal/Yahoo Finance）
item.description:
Alexandra Canal / Yahoo Finance:
Analysts say Neflix's NFL deal marks a “natural evolution” of the company, which had avoided traditional live sports investments, helping boost its ad business  —  Netflix's (NFLX) surprise three-season deal with the NFL marks a major shift for the streaming giant …

item.title: CAAはベリトーンと提携し、Aリスト・アーティストがデジタル資産を保存し、AIによる肖像権使用の対価を得るためのストレージ・システムを構築する（Lauren Forristal/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Lauren Forristal / TechCrunch:
The CAA partners with Veritone to build a storage system for A-list artists to store their digital assets and get compensated for the use of their AI likeness  —  Creative Artists Agency (CAA), one of the top entertainment and sports talent agencies, is hoping to be at the forefront …

item.title: 2013年に存在したウェブページの約38％が現在利用できず、2023年のページの8％が利用できない。ニュースページの23％が少なくとも1つのリンク切れ（ピュー・リサーチ・センター）
item.description:
Pew Research Center:
About 38% of webpages that existed in 2013 are unavailable now and 8% of pages from 2023 are unavailable; 23% of news pages have at least one broken link  —  38% of webpages that existed in 2013 are no longer accessible a decade later  —  Table of Contents Table of Contents

item.title: 2024年のアップフロンツでは、アマゾン・プライム・ビデオとネットフリックスがデビューし、ストリーミングサービスが優勢となり、スポーツ中継とアドテクがより注目された（Stephen Battaglio/Los Angeles Times）
item.description:
Stephen Battaglio / Los Angeles Times:
At the 2024 Upfronts, streaming services dominated with Amazon Prime Video and Netflix making their debut, and live sports and ad tech were given more attention  —  Advertising executives who entered Radio City Music Hall on Monday for NBCUniversal's upfront presentation were greeted …
